Nombre del Proyecto: AI Automation for Bill Entry into Accounting Software (Xero)
DescripciÃ³n:
We are a consulting firm that bills time & materials. We currently spend 100hrs / month entering bills into Xero.

Our current process is:
1. Batch upload PDFs into Xero
2. Manually edit bill-by-bill to enter individual line items.
3. Project manager logs in to review each bill. They assign each bill or line item to a specific client, and approve the bill. Not all bills are billed to clients, there are obviously many that are internal costs.

Step (2) is the most time consuming step, and my interpretation is that step (3) would be hard to automate without knowing context about individual projects. Although, in some cases, the target client is mentioned on the bill.

Xero offers software called Hubdoc, that helps automate repetitive bills. We have yet to try this, and that could be an intermediate step.

Looking for help to develop a tool that reduces our time spent. Presumably, AI is the best chance of understanding context of a bill and breaking it up into individual line items and knowing what client to assign to. 

A tool that reduces time spent by 20% - GOOD!
A tool that reduces time spent by 80% - AMAZING!

Nombre del Proyecto: Web Scrapper GUI Agents Based for Google Maps
DescripciÃ³n:
We are looking for an experienced developer to build a robust desktop-based data collection tool that extracts Points of Interest (POIs) and street-level address data specifically from Google Maps.
The tool will be used for market research and logistics planning. It requires a user-friendly GUI where we can define target areas, combined with a sophisticated backend capable of running multiple scraping agents simultaneously while avoiding detection.
Core Requirements
â€¢ Desktop Application: Windows preferred (Electron, Python/PyQt, or C#).
â€¢ Polygon-Based Targeting: The GUI must allow users to draw or input custom geographic polygons.
â€¢ Smart Grid Segmentation: The tool must automatically split large polygons into smaller "searchable" sub-grids to ensure full data coverage at high zoom levels.
â€¢ Multi-Agent Architecture: The ability to spawn and manage multiple concurrent browser agents to speed up data collection.
â€¢ Data Extraction: Accurately scrape:
â€¢ Business Name & Category
â€¢ Full Address (parsed into Street, Area, City)
â€¢ Geo-coordinates (Lat/Long)
â€¢ Contact Info & Ratings (where available)
â€¢ Export: Data must be cleaner and structured in CSV / Excel / JSON.
Technical Expectations (The Hard Stuff)
â€¢ Advanced Anti-Blocking & Evasion:
â€¢ Must implement fingerprint spoofing (handling Canvas, WebGL, and AudioContext fingerprints) to prevent bot detection.
â€¢ Experience with undetected-chromedriver, Camoufox, or stealth plugins for Puppeteer/Playwright.
â€¢ Proxy & Session Management:
â€¢ Integration with residential proxy networks for IP rotation.
â€¢ Logic to handle sticky sessions vs. rotating IPs based on Googleâ€™s blocking triggers.
â€¢ Geospatial Logic: Experience handling polygon math (Point-in-Polygon) to filter results strictly within the user-defined boundaries.
â€¢ Stability: Automatic retries, error logging, and "cooling off" periods for flagged agents.
Nice to Have
â€¢ CAPTCHA Solving: Integration with 2Captcha, CapSolver, or similar services for manual or automated solving if an agent gets flagged.
â€¢ Resume Capability: If a job crashes or is stopped, it must resume from the last processed grid cell.
â€¢ Business vs. Residential Logic: Heuristics to categorize address types based on data attributes.
What We Care About
â€¢ Evasion over Speed: We prefer a stable scraper that runs 24/7 without getting banned over a fast one that burns IPs.
â€¢ Scalability: The design should handle thousands of POIs without crashing the UI.
â€¢ Clean Code: Modular architecture that allows us to update selectors easily when Google Maps changes its DOM.
To Apply, Please Include:
1. Relevant Past Projects: Specifically mention any experience scraping Google Maps, Yelp, or similar high-security geospatial platforms.
2. Your "Anti-Detect" Strategy: Briefly explain how you handle browser fingerprinting and IP rotation.
3. Tech Stack: What libraries/frameworks would you use for the GUI and the scraping engine?

Knowledge of AI integrations

Nombre del Proyecto: Seeking Zapier Expert for Zap Creation & Troubleshooting
DescripciÃ³n:
I'm currently looking to hire a Zapier expert for automation. On my website, I have 5 different forms that customers can fill out. Each form has a different name, and when it's submitted, we get an email notification for the form submission.

I want to create a zap that will keep count of how many form submissions we receive, each week, for each form, by creating a count that will update on a google sheet. 

ChatGPT tells me we need to create separate "labels" in my gmail account for each form and then auto-assign the approproate label to the email notification once recieved.

The zap will run once a day and count how many emails of each label exists in my gmail account and then update that number on a google sheet. 

This google sheet should be segmented by month. Once the current date surpasses into the next month, the count of labels should automatically move on to the next cell columns for that next months count.

I want to be able to have this zap run autonomously each day and I can just check in periodically on the count to see how many of each form has been filled out in a given month.

I would like for a zap expert to help create these labels in gmail, create the zap that will automatically create this email count on the google sheet. And troubleshoot the zap for any errors.

## ğŸ”¹ SECTION A: EMAIL ENRICHMENT & VALIDATION

### Step A1: Validate Existing Apollo Email (Work Domains Only)

**Field to check:**
- Email (single field from Apollo export)

**Process:**
1. Check Email field:
   - **Has work domain** (company domain, not personal) â†’ Validate with ZeroBounce
     - If ZeroBounce returns "Valid" â†’ STOP email enrichment, move to mobile
     - If ZeroBounce returns "Risky/Catch-all/Unknown" â†’ Continue to Step A2
     - If ZeroBounce returns "Invalid/Disposable/Abuse" â†’ Delete email, continue to Step A2
   - **Has personal domain** (gmail, yahoo, aol, outlook.com, hotmail, icloud, optonline, etc.) â†’ Skip validation, proceed to Step A2
   - **Blank** â†’ Proceed to Step A2

**Key Logic:**
- Only validate emails with work domains (saves ZeroBounce credits)
- Personal domain emails are ignored - proceed to enrichment to find work email
- Stop enrichment only when you have a validated work domain email

---

### Step A2: Enrich with LeadMagic (Primary Source - Work Emails Only)

**Trigger:** No validated work email found in Step A1

**Process:**
1. Call LeadMagic for email enrichment
2. Parse email data:
   - Filter OUT personal domains (gmail, yahoo, outlook, hotmail, icloud, aol, optonline, protonmail, etc.)
   - Only keep work/business domain emails
3. Validate work emails with ZeroBounce
4. Insert FIRST validated work email found:
   - Overwrite existing Email field (whether blank, personal, or risky work email)
5. Stop enriching once you have 1 valid work email

**Rules:**
- Do NOT insert personal emails from LeadMagic (filter them out)
- Only need 1 validated work email - stop enriching after first valid one found
- If LeadMagic returns multiple work emails, validate all, insert first valid one
- Overwrite personal emails from Apollo with work emails
- Proceed to mobile enrichment (Step B2)

---

### Step A3: Enrich with FullEnrich (Fallback Source - Work Emails Only)

**Trigger:** No validated work email found via Apollo OR LeadMagic

**Process:**
1. Call FullEnrich
2. Parse email data:
   - Filter OUT personal domains (gmail, yahoo, outlook, hotmail, icloud, aol, optonline, protonmail, etc.)

3. Validate work emails with ZeroBounce
4. Insert FIRST validated work email found:
   - Overwrite existing Email field (whether blank, personal, or risky work email)
5. Stop enriching once you have 1 validated work email

**Rules:**
- Do NOT insert personal emails from FullEnrich (filter them out)
- **Validate ALL FullEnrich emails with ZeroBounce** (do not trust without validation)
- Only need 1 validated work email
- Overwrite personal emails from Apollo with work emails

## ğŸ”¹ SECTION B: MOBILE NUMBER ENRICHMENT & VALIDATION

### Step B1: Validate Existing Numbers with Clearout

- Home Phone

- De-duplicate across all three phone fields

### Step B2: Enrich with LeadMagic (Primary Source - Mobile)

- Do NOT overwrite existing validated mobile numbers
- Skip duplicates already found in any phone field

---

### Step B3: Enrich with FullEnrich (Fallback Source - Mobile)

**Trigger:** No valid mobile number found via LeadMagic

FullEnrich returns 3 types of numbers. Handle each separately:

#### âœ… Mobile Numbers (from FullEnrich)
Insert into first available core phone field:
1. Mobile Number
2. Other Phone
3. Home Phone

- Do NOT validate with Clearout (trust FullEnrich)
- Do NOT overwrite populated fields
- Skip duplicates

#### âœ… Unverified Phone Numbers (type unknown)
If core phone fields (Mobile/Other/Home) are STILL blank after mobile numbers inserted:
- Insert into remaining slots in Other Phone or Home Phone
- If no space in core fields, insert into:
  - Work Direct Phone
  - Corporate Phone Number

**Rules:**
- Do NOT overwrite
- Skip duplicates

#### âœ… Landline or Work Numbers
NEVER place into Mobile/Other/Home fields

Insert ONLY into:
- Work Direct Phone
- Corporate Phone Number

**Rules:**
- These are reference only, not priority dialing numbers
- Skip duplicates

## ğŸ”¹ SECTION C: FINAL EMAIL STATUS TAGGING (END OF ENRICHMENT) (Unless you have a more efficient part of the process to put this in that doesn't consume another credit)

**After ALL enrichment attempts complete** (Apollo validation + LeadMagic + FullEnrich + Mobile enrichment):

### Step C1: Populate "Email Verified" Column

Check the FINAL Email field and populate accordingly:

**If Email field has work domain:**
- Check validation status from enrichment process
- If validated as "Valid" â†’ Email Verified = Valid
- If validated as "Risky/Catch-all/Unknown" OR not validated â†’ Email Verified = Risky

**If Email field has personal domain:**
- Email Verified = Risky (personal emails = call-only)

**If Email field is blank:**
- Email Verified = Risky (no email = call-only)

**Result:** Every contact has ONE final status tag based on the final state of their email after all enrichment

---

## ğŸ”¹ SECTION D: FINAL CLEANUP & VALIDATION

### Email Field Check:
âœ… Email field contains validated work email when possible  
âœ… Personal emails from Apollo overwritten with work emails when found  
âœ… Personal emails from LeadMagic/FullEnrich filtered out (never inserted)  
âœ… Personal domain emails in Apollo NOT validated (saves ZeroBounce credits)  
âœ… Only work domain emails validated with ZeroBounce  
âœ… ALL emails validated with ZeroBounce (LeadMagic AND FullEnrich)  
âœ… Only 1 validated work email needed (stop enriching after first valid one)  
âœ… "Email Verified" column populated ONCE at end:
- "Valid" = Has validated work email
- "Risky" = No validated work email (includes personal emails, blank, risky work emails)

### Mobile Fields Check:
âœ… Mobile Number, Other Phone, Home Phone contain only valid mobile numbers  
âœ… Landline/work numbers isolated in Work Direct Phone and Corporate Phone Number  
âœ… No duplicates across phone columns  
âœ… No overwriting of existing validated numbers

### Universal Rules:
âœ… LeadMagic called twice per contact (once for email, once for mobile - API limitation as far as I understand)
âœ… Stop email enrichment after finding 1 validated work email  
âœ… Cost-efficient waterfall maintained (LeadMagic â†’ FullEnrich)  
âœ… Email Verified column updated ONCE at the very end with "Valid" or "Risky" (not during process unless recommended otherwise)  
âœ… Clear status for every contact (no blanks in "Email Verified")

Based on initial analysis, the current blueprint appears to have these violations:

Data Entry Requirements:

CRITICAL CONFIGURATION NOTES:

Authentication: We intend to use this app in Prototype Mode (under 10 users) initially. Please configure the authentication to allow external providers (Google / Gmail) so we can invite freelancers who do not have @ourcompany.com email addresses.

Security Filters: Please ensure the "My Tasks" slice works based on the user's email address regardless of their domain.

Deliverables:

The fully built App.

Documentation: A generic "New Project Template" Google Sheet and a 5-minute video showing us how to use, connect a new movie sheet to the app when we start a new project, and delete a sheet when a project is finished.

â• Prioritize clean, scalable architecture; our clients have hundreds of thousands of records, and workflows that sometimes feel like Gordian knots. If you don't have a firm grasp of database architecture, the project fails.
â• Create intuitive, user-friendly interfaces. We need people who design with user empathy in mind, and who care more about dragging fields haphazardly across the screen.
â• Build out clean, thoughtful automations. The difference between "when a record meets conditions" and "when a record is updated" can be pretty big. We need the sort of people who know exactly when to use either.
â• Manage 3-5 client projects simultaneously. 

REQUIREMENTS
â• We don't work with jerks, or people with big egos. That goes for our clients, and it goes for our teammates. We rely on each other for our own success, and we expect each other to help us grow. This is our first and most important requirement.
â• Deep Airtable expertise. We all start from somewhere, and we occasionally hire builders who aren't yet experts. This is not that role, though. Right now, we're only looking for  people who have an extremely strong understanding of optimized base architecture, automation, and workflow design.
â• Excellent written and verbal communication. We work in teams for large projects, and regardless of the size of the project, you'll be working directly with clients. You need to be able to express complex concepts clearly and simply, both in meetings and in writing.
â• Excellent problem solving skills. If you don't know the answer now, you know where to find it (but if you get stuck, you also know when to reach out for advice).
â• Excellent organizational skills. We try to max out our developers at 5 projects because any more than that becomes extremely difficult to manage, but even 3-5 can be tricky! You need to be good at balancing work, and handling context switching. 
â• [OPTIONAL, BUT BOY WOULD IT BE NICE!] Javascript and React expertise (beyond vibecoding), for automations that require scripting or extending native interface functionality with custom interfaces.

EXPERIENCE

â• We don't really care if you have 2 years of experience with Airtable or 10. Those 10 years might have been spent building out simple 1:1 Excel replacements. Those 2 years might have been spent building the most complex workflows known to man. We just need you to be damn good at what you do.

THE LOGISTICS

â• $40-50/hour
â• Contractor-based role
â• Background checks are required as part of our MSAs with most of our largest clients. While taking the background check is optional for you, not doing so will drastically limit the number of projects we're able to offer per the legal requirements of those MSAs
â• While we're open to both part-time to full-time, we've got hella projects in the pipeline, and we're trying to keep our existing Airtable devs from drowning. We'll prioritize applicants who are looking for something 30+ hours and for the long-term.

Nombre del Proyecto: Chatfuel & Make/Zapier Expert for Airbnb Automation (iCal, Sheets, & OCR)
DescripciÃ³n:
(Happy to switch to ManyChat if necessary)

I am looking for a highly skilled Automation Specialist to finalize a Chatfuel bot for my holiday rental business. The bot is 90% complete, but I need an expert to bridge the gap between Chatfuel and external systems (Airbnb, Google Sheets, and payment verification).

Current Setup: Chatfuel (WhatsApp), FAQs and it's 90% running.

Project Scope & Deliverables
1) iCal Integration: Connect my Airbnb iCal feed so the bot can read availability in real-time before allowing a reservation flow.

2) Google Sheets Sync: Connect Chatfuel to a reservation spreadsheet to record: Full Name, Payment Amount, Payment Date, Phone number, Total Amount Owed, and metadata (e.g., "Pets").

3) Scheduled Messaging (Check-in/Check-out):
A) Day of Check-in: Trigger a message early in the morning with a registration link.
B) Standardized Check-in: Automate a set of messages including door codes and arrival instructions.
C) Day of Check-out: Trigger a reminder message including a request for a review.

4) Conditional Reminders: Create a logic flow that sends a reminder if the registration form has not been completed by a certain time.

5) Payment Screenshot Verification: Implement a solution (likely using an OCR API like Google Vision or AWS Textract via Make/Zapier) to read the "Amount Paid" from a user-submitted screenshot and verify it against the record.

6) Standardized welcome message (not AI, standard template) after reserving.

7) Record an airbnb reservation in our spreadsheet

8) (IMPORTANT, ADVICE NEEDED) We will soon get an additional phone number for another property, can you easily copy-paste the entire workflow to that new account? 

Requirements
- Proven experience with Chatfuel and JSON API integrations.
- Expert-level knowledge of Make.com (Integromat) or Zapier.
- Experience handling iCal/ICS files and date formatting.
- Experience with OCR (Optical Character Recognition) for payment verification is a huge plus.

Strong communication and ability to document the final workflow.

To Apply: Please describe a similar automation project you have completed and mention which integration tool (Make or Zapier) you would recommend for this specific setup.

A few tips for our specific issues:
A) The Screenshot Problem: Chatfuel isn't built for OCR (reading text from images). The specialist will likely set up a webhook where Chatfuel sends the image URL to Make, which then passes it through an OCR tool (like OCR.space or Google Vision) to extract the number and send it back to the bot or the sheet.

B) The iCal Logic: Since iCal is just a text feed, the specialist will need to "parse" it to find date overlaps. This is much easier to do in Make than inside Chatfuel itself.

C) The Check-in Form Reminder: To do this "Optionally," the automation needs to check the Google Sheet for a "Form Completed" status at a specific time (e.g., 2 hours after the first link was sent).

BUDGET max $150, this is for a tiny private project only, so we have low budget only

**

Nombre del Proyecto: Backend Engineer for SMS Scheduling Automation
DescripciÃ³n:
**Job Opening: Backend Engineer for SMS and Voice Scheduling Automation (Twilio + Calendar Integration)**

**Overview**

We are seeking a skilled Backend Engineer to join our team in the development of a backend-only scheduling automation platform aimed at converting incoming leads into confirmed appointments for businesses. This project is focused on reliability, logic, and seamless integration, without any user interface or chatbot elements.

**Key Responsibilities**

As a Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for implementing a robust backend service that:

- Receives inbound leads through webhooks, Zapier, or CRM systems.
- Manages SMS communications and inbound voice calls using Twilio.
- Executes a deterministic scheduling logic without any ad-hoc improvisation.
- Integrates with Google Calendar or Calendly for appointment management.
- Ensures appointments are only booked when predefined confirmation criteria are satisfied.
- Sends out confirmation messages and follow-up communications.
- Enforces an immediate stop or opt-out process.
- Logs all operational activities, including message and call transcripts.

**Essential Functional Requirements**

*Messaging (SMS)*

- Implement Twilio for both inbound and outbound messaging.
- Ensure strict compliance with stop requests (hard stop without replies).
- Maintain idempotency and prevent duplicate messages.

*Scheduling*

- Develop deterministic booking rules with explicit confirmation requirements.
- Handle calendar availability and conflict scenarios.
- Implement safe fallback procedures when there is insufficient confidence in scheduling.

*Follow-ups*

- Create configurable follow-up sequences based on user interactions.
- Use call-to-action driven messaging.
- Guarantee immediate termination upon user opt-out.

*Voice Scheduling*

- Manage inbound calls via Twilio Voice with a focus on scheduling.
- Collect user preferences for date/time or time windows.
- Propose specific time slots when necessary, requiring explicit confirmation before booking.
- Send SMS confirmations after appointments are successfully booked.
- Log all call events and transcripts.

*Configuration*

- Allow per-client configuration without requiring code modifications (e.g., business hours, calendar connections, messaging parameters).

*Logging*

- Maintain comprehensive logs of all inbound/outbound messages, call transcripts, booking attempts, outcomes, and reasons for failures.
- Track stop and opt-out events, as well as duplicate prevention incidents.

**Exclusions from Scope**

- No frontend dashboard or user interface.
- No CRM replacement functionalities.
- No creative copywriting or product redesign efforts.

**Technical Requirements**

- Proficient in either Node.js or Python.
- Experience with Twilio (SMS and Voice).
- Familiarity with Google Calendar or Calendly APIs.
- Limited use of large language models (LLMs) for classification and extraction purposes only.
- Competence in any reasonable database solution, with a preference for Postgres.

**Compensation**

- Fixed budget of $5,000.
- The scope of the project is clearly defined, with no user interface components involved. Completion will be determined based on QA outcomes.

**Criteria for Success**

The project will be considered complete when:

- All defined QA scenarios pass successfully.
- Appointments are booked accurately and according to specifications.
- The stop handling process operates flawlessly.
- No unauthorized disclosures occur.
- All logs are comprehensive and trustworthy.

**Note from the Founder**

We are not seeking product design feedback. We need a proficient backend engineer who can efficiently execute a well-defined system with precision and reliability.

Nombre del Proyecto: Data scraping/automation expert
DescripciÃ³n:
Looking for a technically strong scraping / automation expert to help me set up a scalable, longâ€‘running pipeline that extracts product titles, categories, and SEO keywords from bol.com, orchestrated via an AI/browser automation layer.
The goal is to eventually cover millions of products/keywords, while staying within bol.comâ€™s technical and legal constraints
1. Catalog discovery & URL queue (flexible strategy)
- Design and implement a product URL discovery strategy that may include:
Parsing bol.com sitemaps (nlâ€‘nl, nlâ€‘be, frâ€‘be).
Crawling allowed category / listing pages and paginated product grids.
Following internal links (navigation, related products, recommendations) when allowed by robots.txt.
- Respect robots.txt (e.g. avoid /s/, /api/graphql, account/checkout areas, and other disallowed paths). It doesn't need to be necessarily via robot.txt and sitemap
-Store discovered product URLs in a persistent URL queue with statuses (pending, processing, done, failed) so we can run continuously and avoid duplicates.

2. Category / product crawling
Implement safe pagination and deduplication.
Optionally maintain a category table to drive targeted crawling of specific niches.

3. AI/browser agent integration
- Integrate an AI/browser automation solution such as:
Perplexity Comet,
An openâ€‘source agentic browser framework,
A managed tool like Apify / Browse AI / Axiom,
Or a custom Playwright/Selenium + LLM stack.
- The agent should:
Visit product pages,
Extract title, brand, breadcrumbs, important bullets,
Generate SEO keyword sets (primary, longâ€‘tail, tags),
Return structured JSON.
- Design prompt/logic so it behaves â€œhumanâ€‘likeâ€ (delays, scrolling, no direct bol.com API calls like /api/graphql).

4. Orchestration & storage
- Script / workflow that:
Pulls N pending URLs, sends them to the agent,
Ingests JSON results into a database or Google Sheet,
Updates URL status and handles retries with backoff.
- The system should be able to run continuously (e.g. on a schedule) without manual babysitting.

5. Scale & antiâ€‘blocking
Sensible rate limiting and concurrency.
Ability to plug in residential/ISP proxies later if needed.
Logging and simple monitoring (success/fail rates, processed URLs).

Nombre del Proyecto: Adalo + Zapier Expert Needed for Data Workflow and UI Fixes
DescripciÃ³n:
Overview
We have an Adalo app that collects user input via an onboarding flow and sends that data to Zapier via webhook. In Zapier we generate structured output using AI and write results back into Adalo collections.

Scope of Work
A) Zapier â†’ AI â†’ Adalo (data pipeline)

- Receive onboarding data from Adalo (Webhook trigger).
- Use AI in Zapier to produce structured JSON output.

B) Adalo UI/relationship issues (3 items)
Home screen: show one filtered â€œnext itemâ€ and its child list on the same screen
We can display one filtered parent record (max 1), but we canâ€™t reliably scope a child list to only that parent on the same screen.

C) Button navigation: missing/wrong record context on destination screen
A button should start a flow by opening the first child record of the selected parent. Currently, the destination screen sometimes expects a different record type/context, causing â€œmissing data.â€


D) Detail screen: linked data from related records not visible or blank
On a detail screen we want to display fields from a related record, but those linked fields show blank or arenâ€™t available even though records exist.


Budget / Rate
Prefer to set a budget. 
Send an offer with the amount of hours you will need for it. 

Deliverables
- Working Zapier workflow that creates/updates linked Adalo records correctly from AI JSON.
- Fixes for the 3 Adalo issues above (with step-by-step instructions).
- Short handover notes: how to test, key settings, and how to reset.

To apply (please include)
- Dutch language is a big plus for communication. Include if you speak dutch.
- Your experience with Adalo relationships + list scoping (brief example).
- Your experience with Zapier handling nested JSON (parsing + creating multiple linked records).
- Estimated timeline + hours for an MVP.
